meanings.definition: Having or showing an extreme greed for wealth or material gain.
meanings.sent1: The avaricious man hoarded all his money and refused to share.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her avaricious behavior, always wanting more than she had.
meanings.sent3: The avaricious squirrel collected so many nuts that it couldn't fit them all in its tree.
meanings.sent4: His avaricious eyes gleamed at the sight of the treasure chest.
meanings.sent5: The avaricious dragon guarded its pile of gold with fierce determination.

meanings.definition: Characterized by avarice; greedy or covetous.
meanings.sent1: The avaricious businessman would do anything to increase his profits.
meanings.sent2: The avaricious queen demanded tribute from all her subjects.
meanings.sent3: The avaricious cat tried to steal food from the other pets in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her avaricious nature led her to constantly compare her possessions with others.
meanings.sent5: The avaricious landlord raised the rent every chance he got.
